text.text_translated: Asteroids are large rocks that travel in space. Some of them are called 'Potentially Hazardous'. This name tells us they could become a danger. This is because they can pass within 7.5 million kilometres of our planet's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 of these objects, but they do not expect any of them to be a threat in the next one hundred years. NASA has technology that is already available. They can use it to track these asteroids and predict if one might hit Earth. In the case of a predicted impact, they could use two defence solutions.
